result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS:  Pay all court costs, fees, surcharges and mandatory DNA surcharge.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay $100.00 per month starting 8/4/14.  All unpaid obligations to be established by DOC, probation and parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/seling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with victim Alejandro L. and Anita S.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count one.  Credit for three (3) days.
Concurrent to count one.  Same conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Diaz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( x ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  01/11/2015      Initials:  sm
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $624 entered as ordered by the court on 08/25/14 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 10/01/15. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.  Copies to the defendant, defense attorney, and financial dept.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
FILED.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
FILED.
Alexandra Wirth.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn Spanish Interpreter: Alexandra Wirth

-  AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
-  COUNT 1 AMENDED to Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.
-  COUNT 2 AMENDED/ADDED as Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500), contrary to 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 and AMENDED/ADDED COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 3 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1. Credit for 3 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 18 MONTHS, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-no possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol;
-random urine screens if deemed appropriate;
-obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation;
-no contact with victim, Alejandro L and Anita S;
-pay restitution in the amount of $ZERO;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (BOTH COUNTS); failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge (BOTH COUNTS); failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-
-  Court ORDERS defendant to pay $100.00, per month starting 08-04-2014.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Plea and Sentencing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter needed for all proceedings.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Call received from Attorney Eduardo Borda informing Court that he is unable to accept appointment as Counsel for the defense due to other court obligations.  Court appoints Attorney Julius Andriusis as counsel for defense Attorney Andriusis accepts the appointment. Attorney Andriusis is contacting Defendant to inform him of new developments and to let him know that he will be representing him at the Preliminary Hearing and future hearings in this action.  Order SIGNED AND FILED.
Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court.   

Spanish Interpreter sworn:  Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant requests a court appointed attorney.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based on defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the defendant is indigent.  Defendant agrees that the Attorney shall be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour. Defendant agrees to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expenses paid by Milwaukee County on a payment plan to be established at a later time. Court appoints Attorney Eduardo Borda as counsel for defendant.  Preliminary Hearing, previously scheduled for 04-25-2014 at 01:30pm in Preliminary Court, remains calendared.  Defendant reminded of Preliminary Hearing date, time and location.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the address of 408 W. Harrison Ave., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for public defender representation due to employment income.  He is requesting an indigency hearing in front of the Court.

Defendant Ruben Diaz in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ruben Diaz in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Liesl Monroy  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
